creator: sherold@netbeans.org
text:
Ant gives me the following message although the project name is not even set in 
the c.xml file. If I comment out the antcall task in the b.xml file, the 
message disappears. I am attaching the relevant project you can test it on.

Buildfile: build.xml

build:
Duplicated project name in import. Project project-b defined first 
in /home/sherold/test/c.xml and again in /home/sherold/test/b.xml

problem:

BUILD SUCCESSFUL
Total time: 0 seconds

creator: peterreilly@apache.org
text:
Thanks for the report, it looks like
antcall does not mix too good with <import>
I am not too sure what to do, the property ant.file.{currentprojectname}
gets inherited, this causes the problem.
I think that ant.file.{currentprojectname} should not be used if the
project name is not set in the build file - it is confusing
and useless as it gets overridden by imported projects
without names.

creator: peterreilly@apache.org
